Jim Cakalic wrote:

>Ron Jeffries C# implementation (or one of them) of the Bowling Game
>problem contains several private methods:
>  
>
Straw man argument, Jim - neith Ilja nor I are saying that you shouldn't 
have private methods. We are saying that the desire to _test_ a private 
method is an indication that the method should be public, and probably 
on another class.

If you look at my code, you'll see lots of private methods - you also 
won't see tests for any of them. I'm reasonably sure that Ilja would say 
the same thing.

Robert.
